intro: Euphrasia algoviana, commonly known as the Algovian eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and somewhat branched. Euphrasia algoviana is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to support eye health and treat various inflammatory conditions.
